instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5V 0.1/0.4A - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDO</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Hi, I am dealing with this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, which gets 5V 0.1A on one set of USB-C chips UB300/400 (these had liquid residue all around them) and 5V 0.44A <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/3200 on the other set. 

UB300 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> - short - 0.0125Vdc
UB400 - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO</SIGNAL> - short - 0.0130Vdc

Shall I measure something else before I tackle these chips?
No noticeable short on bigger coils.

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 0.5165dc
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> - 0.5182dc

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5V 0.1/0.4A - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDO</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Please, stop to post "Vdc" when you post diode mode readings.

Very likely bad chips.
However, check first removing the corresponding filter caps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - 5V 0.1/0.4A - <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_LDO</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full"]60122[/ATTACH]


Thanks, I found the issue.
